Draw a polyline with the following line segments: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.3214] - Line 3: Start Point [0.75, 0.3214], End Point [0.5357, 0.3214] - Line 4: Start Point [0.5357, 0.3214], End Point [0.5357, 0.5357] - Line 5: Start Point [0.5357, 0.5357], End Point [0.2143, 0.5357] - Line 6: Start Point [0.2143, 0.5357], End Point [0.2143, 0.3214] - Line 7: Start Point [0.2143, 0.3214], End Point [0.0, 0.3214] - Line 8: Start Point [0.0, 0.3214], End Point [0.0, 0.0] This polyline forms a closed profile for the base of the part. The shape of this profile is a slightly tapered rectangle. Now, let's scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. 1. Apply a scaling transformation with a scale factor of 0.75 to the sketch. Next, we will extrude the 2D sketch to create the 3D part. 1. Extrude the 2D sketch by a depth of 0.3214 units along the normal direction. After completing these steps, you will have created the first intermediate part as described in the assembly JSON. The part is a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top and bottom, and its dimensions are approximately 10 units in length, 5 units in width, and 3 units in height, with the base being 0.75 units thick. You can proceed with the next part of the CAD model assembly, following the same instructions and data provided in the JSON.</description>
